remarks: For a polynomial matrix there is an upper bound for the coefficients of all the polynomials being not 0.  (Contributed by AV, 3-Oct-2019.) (Proof shortened by AV, 28-Nov-2019.)
statement:
pmatcoe1fsupp.p $e |- P = ( Poly1 ` R ) $.
pmatcoe1fsupp.c $e |- C = ( N Mat P ) $.
pmatcoe1fsupp.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
pmatcoe1fsupp.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
pmatcoe1fsupp $p |- ( ( N e. Fin /\ R e. Ring /\ M e. B ) -> E. s e. NN0 A. x e. NN0 ( s < x -> A. i e. N A. j e. N ( ( coe1 ` ( i M j ) ) ` x ) = .0. ) ) $.
$d .0. i j s x $.
$d B i j s x $.
$d C x $.
$d M i j s x $.
$d N i j s x $.
$d R i j s x $.
